segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the job application proposal by means of its type and number and, when necessary, its function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the document date. The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date or time or period requires to be logically related to another specified data item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying names of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the Job Application Proposal Message. Identification of the enterprise and the job administration parties is mandatory for the Job Application Proposal Message. It is recommended that, where possible, only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. where the enterprise and the job administration are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required, but a job center or a job application address (interview) may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment indicating the address of the relevant party.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the ADR segment, e.g. internal site or building number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the PNA segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment, e.g. telephone-number, fax-number, telex-number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments for giving references and, where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number related to the whole message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the whole message.

segment.name: General indicator
segment.documentation: GIS, A segment specifying general indicators for the whole message.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation:
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A mandatory service segment placed before the first user segment in the detail section to avoid segment collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing details of a job application. This Segment group may be repeated to give information about several other job application proposals. The Segment group 5 gives detailed information, in coded or textual form, e.g. job advertisement, of one or more applicants. The information may be related to an earlier sent job order of an employer.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the administrative operation of a job application by a number given by an employment agency, e.g. order number of an employment agency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date and, when relevant, time relating to the RFF segment. Examples of the use of this DTM segment are: order date or time of the employment agency.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments identifying an applicant and related information for a job requirement.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment giving the identity of the applicant.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date of birth of the applicant.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the place of birth of the applicant. It may also specify requirements regarding the job location.

segment.name: Nationality
segment.documentation: NAT, A segment indicating nationality (or nationalities) of the person identified in the previous PNA segment.

segment.name: Person demographic information
segment.documentation: PDI, A segment providing personal information about the applicant: i.e. gender, marital status.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment indicating the list of documents the concerned person has in his possession.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the proposed person.

segment.name: General indicator
segment.documentation: GIS, A segment specifying general indicators related to the proposed person.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying requirements or conditions of one or more applicants.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to give in coded form the requirements for a job application.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information (job qualifications and requirements for individual applicants) related to job advertisement, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments giving information about the requesting remuneration and conditions regarding the remuneration.

segment.name: Remuneration type identification
segment.documentation: SAL, A segment identifying the type of the remuneration requested, and if relevant the name of the remuneration type or contract.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment used when additional information regarding the remuneration type or contract and which cannot be accommodated within other segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving attribute information, in coded form for the remuneration and, where necessary, additional textual information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying additional remuneration information in coded form. The codes are also related to working condition, working time, employment contract, piece work and remuneration benefits.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment specifying in free text form the additional information which cannot be accommodate within other segments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments specifying processing indicators and, if necessary, additional textual information, relevant to the required remuneration.

segment.name: General indicator
segment.documentation: GIS, A segment specifying general indicator related to the remuneration required.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment specifying in free text form a process regarding the required remuneration which cannot be accommodated within another segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments specifying the type and the amount of the remuneration or a remuneration range required.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving information about the type and the amount of the remuneration required.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify a remuneration range when the exact remuneration of the previous MOA segment is not available. The remuneration range is related to the type of remuneration in the MOA segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment in coded and free text form to specify any other information regarding the remuneration amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying a profession or occupation of an applicant and attributes of a profession or occupation related to the job advertisement.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, A segment to identify the related area or sector of a qualification and a qualification, in coded or clear form, related to the job advertisement.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location or place, where the qualification or job should be performed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments giving coded information about the attributes of a profession relating to education and experience and, when necessary, priority of the information and additional textual information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying, in coded form, the attributes of a profession. The codes are related to education, job experience, special knowledge and qualifications.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment identifying the priority of requirements for a job offered.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments giving information about languages and experiences of languages.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment specifying a language in coded or clear form.

segment.name: General indicator
segment.documentation: GIS, A segment specifying general indicators of the experience of a language.
